name: catachresis
text:
This is the strip that brought forward Risotto Wars. The Dude & Catastrophe. Lyle In A Nunnery.
This strip heralded the birth of the best Achewood ever.

It needs a 5.

name: wehavemagnums
text: The blogs are ESSENTIAL and AMAZING. But this still gets a 3.

name: i_love_kate
text: Yeah, I felt that fiving this strip was the best way for me to show my appreciation for the blogs. But that's just me.

name: hellofyellin
text: I'm sorry, "Put on your Face Eyes and sit in your Body Chair" earns this comic a 4.  I love me some Beef.

name: carlyle
text: Six months from now, your timestamp will read one year ago and mine six months ago. I hope somebody comes along then and comments on mine to keep this chain going.

name: gingerkid
text: I'm just commenting to keep the chain going.  :)  Six months from now your timestamp will read eight months ago and mine will read six months ago!

name: nice-on-water
text: But five months from now this reads 5 months ago and his reads eight months ago :o :o :o Oh god

name: twohundredninety
text: I bumped this up to a 2 because it included the phrases "Face Eyes" and "Body Chair."

name: teknofatcat
text: Yay! Blogs!

name: teknofatcat

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, silver_lake, katsura, wargasmic, rowboat, equinn2006, woodenteeth, atticusonline, BillyLK, slalvation, Nictusempra)

name: katsura
text: no, that honor belongs to the cumbrella strip

name: excusemesenator
text: But that wasn't Onstad's product, so I really wouldn't count it.

name: rowboat
text: The only "worst strips" are re-runs (with the obvious exception of most of the guest strips, which, as excusemesenator correctly pointed out, shouldn't be held against Onstad). For whatever reason he wasn't able or willing to post a proper strip at that time, he could've just thrown a re-run up here. But he didn't. He instead brought us Face Eyes and Body Chair, and for that I think we (you) should be grateful.

name: fineoakstructure
text: I agree 100%.  Hell, I gave it a five just because it announces the beginning of the blogs; but I mainly did just for the Face Eyes and Body Chair.

text: I liked the cumbrella strip.

name: kledermans
text: I could only find out seven breakfasts.  I fail.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

-Ray-
I got to get rid of some Nagels
A new kind of rum!
Nobody around?

-Roast Beef-
h.w.
7-11
man don't go by the sports bar unless you want to get depressed

-Pat-
I Guess Some Friends Don't Remember When You Are Supposed To Do Things Together.
Even Spam can't get Spam right!
Well this was a lousy week!

-Teodor-
These blog templates are corny
Bizarre Love Triangle

-Philippe-
Flashdance! is on!
I have a tummy ache
uh oh I did it
a good day!

-Mr. Bear-
The New Bryson
Drat, I Have Read More Bryson.

-Lyle-
fuck you
hahahahahaahhahah
pised on side of house
woke up on a burn

-Molly-
Roast Beef is so silly
Bill Cosby is Set Aflame!
Thank god gramma K is finally in the shower

-Onstad-
Friday's breakfast
I didn't have breakfast today; more.
Lunch was pretty good today.

name: xiaomimi
text: I've wished we could read the blogs in order along with the strips, and I think I've seen a few comments to that effect as well.  Do people like this idea?  You can spam it away if not.  It's pretty long for now, though I expect that calms down after the initial blogging push.  If people think it's a good idea I can keep doing it.

name: hellofyellin
text: You just should get all sorts of chubs for your Transmet Avatar pic.  Just... chubs upon chubs.

name: rowboat
text: I've said this before, but since it started here I'll say it again: it's a fine thing you're doing here, xiaomimi.

name: mysterymeat1001
text: This was definitely a good idea! I think you've made quite a large contribution here.

name: mattylite
text: Thank you.

name: firesign
text: I know I've commented elsewhere, but this practice is, of course, extremely helpful. I tried going through each blog in order once before, but having them lined up in parallel here is far better. They make more sense in the context of the strips, and particularly in context of each other (Ray gets new rum/Lyle finds new rum, Ray is pissed because nobody attended his party/Philippe is thrilled because everyone came to his, etc.) I also seem to recall that the blogs explained why Cornelius was where he was when Pat shot him, among many other connections to the strips. This idea for a project was awesome, and I'm glad you kept it up.

name: notcool
text:
Every time I see a post of yours, I chubby it.

You need to post more!

name: le_baron_noir
text:
Quote:
I should like to take this opportunity to forewarn you against reading any of Bill Bryson's A Short History of Nearly Everything....

A tumbler of Talisker is unquestionably the ideal cure for this variety of existential turbulence.

Cornelius' wisdom is boundless.

name: le_baron_noir
text:
Also...
I'm not too happy with how many directions my mind shot in whilst considering the implications of Teodor's use of "Nature's Miracle" and a trowl to help with Philippe's condition.

At least three unappealing ideas completely blindsided me.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i was hella excited to see what the xiaomimi comment on this page had to offer.

i am so glad it is so expansive.

i chubbied this so hard i almost had to get a new mouse.

name: bjorntd
text: Roast Beef! Do not wear a cape!

name: zathyr
text: Roast Beef, you are the Pope. How come?

name: unsentletter
text: There is the sense of pure bleariness in the writing of this strip.  I sense it and I appreciate it.

name: wilbur
text: When I need cheering up, I imagine Roast Beef saying this in the voice of Flavor Flav.

name: rhinoheart
text: this is seriously the most hilarious thing I have ever read.
